e="preserve">Wheel theory is the theory of wheels. A wheel is an algebraic structure where division by 0 has meaning. The term "wheel" was inspired by the topological picture formula_1.
Definition.
Wheels replace the usual division with a unary operator applied to one argument formula_1 similar (but not identical) to the multiplicative inverse formula_1, such that formula_1 becomes shorthand for formula_1. Also, formula_1 replaces the fraction formula_1.
